alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; York (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTH CENTRAL CLAY... NORTHWESTERN YORK AND HAMILTON COUNTIES THROUGH 545 PM CDT... At 515 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Giltner, or 15 miles southeast of Grand Island, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Aurora around 520 PM CDT. Hampton around 525 PM CDT. Marquette around 530 PM CDT. Bradshaw around 535 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Hordville. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 319 and 345. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for south central, central and east central Nebraska.
